chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenshawn D Barnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(bm).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: filed.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 7-22-2022
Letters for Sentencing

Defendant Kenshawn D Barnett in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1 and 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 9 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS.

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel. 

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody, to report to DODGE.

Defendant Kenshawn D Barnett in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Chad Boyack.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Kenshawn D Barnett in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Kenshawn D Barnett in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 38.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
